title: Bush Sr Military-Industrial Complex Consolidation and Defense Contractor Capture (1989-1993)
description: Research Bush Sr administration's systematic consolidation of military-industrial complex through defense industry merger facilitation, revolving door institutionalization, and Pentagon capture acceleration. Document end of Cold War exploitation to justify continued defense spending through new threat construction and contractor dependency establishment. Focus on how Bush Sr's defense industry connections enabled systematic taxpayer resource transfer to private military contractors establishing permanent warfare state infrastructure.
constitutional_issues: democratic oversight erosion through contractor capture
taxpayer protection violations through systematic resource transfer
congressional war powers circumvention through contractor dependency
public interest subordination to military-industrial complex
